text: Antoniów () is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Stara Kamienica, within Jelenia Góra County, Lower Silesian Voivodeship, in south- western Poland. It lies approximately south-west of Stara Kamienica, west of Jelenia Góra, and west of the regional capital Wrocław. During World War II, the Germans established and operated a forced labour camp in the village, in which they imprisoned Italian and Soviet prisoners of war.Dorota Sula, Jeńcy włoscy na Dolnym Śląsku w czasie II wojny światowej, "Łambinowicki rocznik muzealny" Tom 33, Opole, 2010, p. 63 (in Polish) The prisoners lived and worked in poor sanitary conditions, and were forced to exhausting labour. ==References== Category:Villages in Jelenia Góra County
title: Antoniów, Lower Silesian Voivodeship
